verses.verse: "And in the first <WH259> year <WH8141> of Darius <WH1867> the Mede, <WH4075> I arose <WH5975> to be an encouragement <WH2388> and a protection <WH4581> for him.

"And now <WH6258> I will tell <WH5046> you the truth. <WH571> Behold, <WH2009> three <WH7969> more <WH5750> kings <WH4428> are going to arise <WH5975> in Persia. <WH6539> Then a fourth <WH7243> will gain <WH6238> far <WH1419> more <WH1419> riches <WH6239> than <WH4480> all <WH3605> [of them;] as soon as he becomes strong <WH2393> through his riches, <WH6239> he will arouse <WH5782> the whole <WH3605> [empire] against the realm <WH4438> of Greece. <WH3120>
"And a mighty <WH1368> king <WH4428> will arise, <WH5975> and he will rule <WH4910> with great <WH7227> authority <WH4474> and do <WH6213> as he pleases. <WH7522>

"But as soon as he has arisen, <WH5975> his kingdom <WH4438> will be broken <WH7665> up and parceled <WH2673> out toward the four <WH702> points <WH7307> of the compass, <WH8064> though not to his [own] descendants, <WH319> nor <WH3808> according to his authority <WH4915> which <WH834> he wielded; <WH4910> for his sovereignty <WH4438> will be uprooted <WH5428> and [given] to others <WH312> besides <WH4480> <WH905> them.

"Then the king <WH4428> of the South <WH5045> will grow <WH2388> strong, <WH2388> along with [one] of his princes <WH8269> who will gain <WH2388> ascendancy <WH2388> over <WH5921> him and obtain <WH4910> dominion; <WH4910> his domain <WH4475> [will be] a great <WH7227> dominion <WH4475> [indeed].

"And after <WH7093> some years <WH8141> they will form <WH2266> an alliance, <WH2266> and the daughter <WH1323> of the king <WH4428> of the South <WH5045> will come <WH935> to the king <WH4428> of the North <WH6828> to carry <WH6213> out a peaceful <WH4339> arrangement. <WH4339> But she will not retain <WH6113> her position <WH2220> of power, <WH3581> nor <WH3808> will he remain <WH5975> with his power, <WH2220> but she will be given <WH5414> up, along with those who brought <WH935> her in, and the one who sired <WH3205> her, as well as he who supported <WH2388> her in [those] times. <WH6256>

"But one of the descendants <WH5342> of her line <WH8328> will arise <WH5975> in his place, <WH3653> and he will come <WH935> against <WH413> [their] army <WH2428> and enter <WH935> the fortress <WH4581> of the king <WH4428> of the North, <WH6828> and he will deal <WH6213> with them and display <WH2388> [great] strength. <WH2388>

"And also <WH1571> their gods <WH430> with their metal <WH9331> images <WH9331> [and] their precious <WH2532> vessels <WH3627> of silver <WH3701> and gold <WH2091> he will take <WH935> into captivity <WH7628> to Egypt, <WH4714> and he on his part <WH1931> will refrain <WH5975> from [attacking] the king <WH4428> of the North <WH6828> for [some] years. <WH8141>
"Then the latter will enter <WH935> the realm <WH4438> of the king <WH4428> of the South, <WH5045> but will return <WH7725> to his [own] land. <WH127>

"And his sons <WH1121> will mobilize <WH1624> and assemble <WH622> a multitude <WH1995> of great <WH7227> forces; <WH2428> and one of them will keep <WH935> on coming <WH935> and overflow <WH7857> and pass <WH5674> through, <WH5674> that he may again <WH7725> wage <WH1624> war <WH1624> up to his [very] fortress. <WH4581>

"And the king <WH4428> of the South <WH5045> will be enraged <WH4843> and go <WH3318> forth <WH3318> and fight <WH3898> with the king <WH4428> of the North. <WH6828> Then the latter will raise <WH5975> a great <WH7227> multitude, <WH1995> but [that] multitude <WH1995> will be given <WH5414> into the hand <WH3027> of the [former].

"When the multitude <WH1995> is carried <WH5375> away, his heart <WH3824> will be lifted <WH7311> up, and he will cause tens <WH7239> of thousands <WH7239> to fall; <WH5307> yet he will not prevail. <WH5810>

"For the king <WH4428> of the North <WH6828> will again <WH7725> raise <WH5975> a greater <WH7227> multitude <WH1995> than <WH4480> the former, <WH7223> and after <WH7093> an interval <WH7093> <WH6256> of some <WH6256> years <WH8141> he will press <WH935> on with a great <WH1419> army <WH2428> and much <WH7227> equipment. <WH7399>

"Now in those <WH1992> times <WH6256> many <WH7227> will rise <WH5975> up against <WH5921> the king <WH4428> of the South; <WH5045> the violent <WH6530> ones <WH1121> <WH6530> among your people <WH5971> will also lift <WH5375> themselves up in order to fulfill <WH5975> the vision, <WH2377> but they will fall <WH3782> down. <WH3782>

"Then the king <WH4428> of the North <WH6828> will come, <WH935> cast <WH8210> up a siege <WH5550> mound, <WH5550> and capture <WH3920> a well-fortified city; <WH5892> and the forces <WH2220> of the South <WH5045> will not stand <WH5975> [their ground,] not even their choicest <WH4005> troops, <WH5971> for there <WH369> will be no <WH369> strength <WH3581> to make <WH5975> a stand. <WH5975>

"But he who comes <WH935> against <WH413> him will do <WH6213> as he pleases, <WH7522> and no <WH369> one <WH369> will [be able to] withstand <WH6440> <WH5975> him; he will also stay <WH5975> [for a time] in the Beautiful <WH9469> Land, <WH776> with destruction <WH3617> in his hand. <WH3027>

"And he will set <WH7760> his face <WH6440> to come <WH935> with the power <WH8633> of his whole <WH3605> kingdom, <WH4438> bringing with him a proposal <WH3477> of peace <WH3477> which he will put <WH6213> into effect; <WH6213> he will also give <WH5414> him the daughter <WH1323> of women <WH802> to ruin <WH7843> it. But she will not take <WH5975> a stand <WH5975> [for him] or be on his side.

"Then he will turn <WH7725> his face <WH6440> to the coastlands <WH339> and capture <WH3920> many. <WH7227> But a commander <WH7101> will put <WH7673> a stop <WH7673> to his scorn <WH2781> against him; moreover, <WH1115> he will repay <WH7725> him for his scorn. <WH2781>
"So he will turn <WH7725> his face <WH6440> toward the fortresses <WH4581> of his own land, <WH776> but he will stumble <WH3782> and fall <WH5307> and be found <WH4672> no <WH3808> more.

"Then in his place <WH3653> one will arise <WH5975> who will send <WH5674> an oppressor <WH5065> through <WH5674> the Jewel <WH1925> of [his] kingdom; <WH4438> yet within a few <WH259> days <WH3117> he will be shattered, <WH7665> though neither <WH3808> in anger <WH639> nor <WH3808> in battle. <WH4421>

"And in his place <WH3653> a despicable <WH959> person will arise, <WH5975> on whom the honor <WH1935> of kingship <WH4438> has not been conferred, <WH5414> but he will come <WH935> in a time <WH7962> of tranquility <WH7962> and seize <WH2388> the kingdom <WH4438> by intrigue. <WH2519>

"And the overflowing <WH7858> forces <WH2220> will be flooded <WH7857> away <WH7857> before <WH4480> <WH6440> him and shattered, <WH7665> and also <WH1571> the prince <WH5057> of the covenant. <WH1285>

"And after <WH4480> an alliance <WH2266> is made <WH2266> with him he will practice <WH6213> deception, <WH4820> and he will go <WH5927> up and gain <WH6105> power <WH6105> with a small <WH4592> [force of] people. <WH1471>

"In a time <WH7962> of tranquility <WH7962> he will enter <WH935> the richest <WH9304> [parts] of the realm, <WH4082> and he will accomplish <WH6213> what <WH834> his fathers never <WH1> did, <WH3808> nor <WH6213> his ancestors; he will distribute <WH3808> plunder, <WH1> booty, <WH967> and possessions <WH961> among them, and he will devise <WH7998> his schemes <WH7399> against <WH2803> strongholds, <WH4284> but [only] for a time. <WH5921>

"And he will stir <WH5782> up his strength <WH3581> and courage <WH3824> against <WH5921> the king <WH4428> of the South <WH5045> with a large <WH1419> army; <WH2428> so the king <WH4428> of the South <WH5045> will mobilize <WH1624> an extremely <WH5704> <WH3966> large <WH1419> and mighty <WH6099> army <WH2428> for war; <WH4421> but he will not stand, <WH5975> for schemes <WH4284> will be devised <WH2803> against <WH5921> him.

"And those who eat <WH398> his choice <WH6598> food <WH6598> will destroy <WH7665> him, and his army <WH2428> will overflow, <WH7857> but many <WH7227> will fall <WH5307> down <WH5307> slain. <WH2491>

"As for both <WH8147> kings, <WH4428> their hearts <WH3824> will be [intent] on evil, <WH7489> and they will speak <WH1696> lies <WH3577> [to each other] at the same <WH259> table; <WH7979> but it will not succeed, <WH6743> for the end <WH7093> is still <WH5750> [to come] at the appointed <WH4150> time. <WH4150>

"Then he will return <WH7725> to his land <WH776> with much <WH1419> plunder; <WH7399> but his heart <WH3824> will be [set] against <WH5921> the holy <WH6944> covenant, <WH1285> and he will take <WH6213> action <WH6213> and [then] return <WH7725> to his [own] land. <WH776>

"At the appointed <WH4150> time <WH4150> he will return <WH7725> and come <WH935> into the South, <WH5045> but this last <WH314> time <WH314> it will not turn <WH1961> out the way it did before. <WH7223>

"For ships <WH6716> of Kittim <WH3794> will come <WH935> against him; therefore he will be disheartened, <WH3512> and will return <WH7725> and become <WH2194> enraged <WH2194> at the holy <WH6944> covenant <WH1285> and take <WH6213> action; <WH6213> so he will come <WH7725> back <WH7725> and show <WH995> regard <WH995> for those who forsake <WH5800> the holy <WH6944> covenant. <WH1285>

"And forces <WH2220> from him will arise, <WH5975> desecrate <WH2490> the sanctuary <WH4720> fortress, <WH4581> and do <WH5493> away <WH5493> with the regular <WH8548> sacrifice. <WH8548> And they will set <WH5414> up the abomination <WH8251> of desolation. <WH8074>

"And by smooth <WH2514> [words] he will turn <WH2610> to godlessness <WH2610> those who act <WH7561> wickedly <WH7561> toward the covenant, <WH1285> but the people <WH5971> who know <WH3045> their God <WH430> will display <WH2388> strength <WH2388> and take <WH6213> action. <WH6213>

"And those who have <WH7919> insight <WH7919> among the people <WH5971> will give <WH995> understanding <WH995> to the many; <WH7227> yet they will fall <WH3782> by sword <WH2719> and by flame, <WH3852> by captivity <WH7628> and by plunder, <WH961> for [many] days. <WH3117>
"Now when they fall <WH3782> they will be granted <WH5826> a little <WH4592> help, <WH5828> and many <WH7227> will join <WH3867> with them in hypocrisy. <WH2519>

"And some <WH4480> of those who have <WH7919> insight <WH7919> will fall, <WH3782> in order to refine, <WH6884> purge, <WH1305> and make <WH3835> them pure, <WH3835> until <WH5704> the end <WH7093> time; <WH6256> because <WH3588> [it is] still <WH5750> [to come] at the appointed <WH4150> time. <WH4150>

"Then the king <WH4428> will do <WH6213> as he pleases, <WH7522> and he will exalt <WH7311> and magnify <WH1431> himself above <WH5921> every <WH3605> god, <WH410> and will speak <WH1696> monstrous <WH6381> things <WH6381> against <WH5921> the God <WH410> of gods; <WH410> and he will prosper <WH6743> until <WH5704> the indignation <WH2195> is finished, <WH3615> for that which is decreed <WH2782> will be done. <WH6213>

"And he will show <WH995> no <WH3808> regard <WH995> for the gods <WH430> of his fathers or for the desire <WH1> of women, <WH2532> nor <WH802> will he show <WH3808> regard <WH995> for any <WH995> [other] god; <WH3605> for he will magnify <WH433> himself above <WH1431> [them] all. <WH5921>

"But instead <WH5921> <WH3653> he will honor <WH3513> a god <WH433> of fortresses, <WH4581> a god <WH433> whom <WH834> his fathers did not know; <WH1> he will honor <WH3045> [him] with gold, <WH3513> silver, <WH2091> costly <WH3701> stones, <WH3368> and treasures. <WH68>

"And he will take <WH6213> action <WH6213> against the strongest <WH4581> of fortresses <WH4581> with [the help of] a foreign <WH5236> god; <WH433> he will give <WH7235> great <WH7235> honor <WH9202> to those who <WH834> acknowledge <WH5234> [him,] and he will cause them to rule <WH4910> over the many, <WH7227> and will parcel <WH2505> out land <WH127> for a price. <WH4242>

"And at the end <WH7093> time <WH6256> the king <WH4428> of the South <WH5045> will collide <WH5055> with him, and the king <WH4428> of the North <WH6828> will storm <WH9621> against <WH5921> him with chariots, <WH7393> with horsemen, <WH6571> and with many <WH7227> ships; <WH591> and he will enter <WH935> countries, <WH776> overflow <WH7857> [them,] and pass <WH5674> through. <WH5674>

"He will also enter <WH935> the Beautiful <WH9469> Land, <WH776> and many <WH7227> [countries] will fall; <WH3782> but these <WH428> will be rescued <WH4422> out of his hand: <WH3027> Edom, <WH9000> Moab <WH4124> and the foremost <WH7225> of the sons <WH1121> of Ammon. <WH5983>
"Then he will stretch <WH7971> out his hand <WH3027> against [other] countries, <WH776> and the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> will not escape. <WH6413>

"But he will gain <WH4910> control <WH4910> over the hidden <WH4362> treasures <WH4362> of gold <WH2091> and silver, <WH3701> and over all <WH3605> the precious <WH9143> things <WH9143> of Egypt; <WH4714> and Libyans <WH3864> and Ethiopians <WH3569> [will follow] at his heels. <WH4703>

"But rumors <WH8052> from the East <WH4217> and from the North <WH6828> will disturb <WH926> him, and he will go <WH3318> forth <WH3318> with great <WH1419> wrath <WH2534> to destroy <WH8045> and annihilate <WH2763> many. <WH7227>

"And he will pitch <WH5193> the tents <WH168> of his royal <WH643> pavilion <WH643> between <WH996> the seas <WH3220> and the beautiful <WH9469> Holy <WH6944> Mountain; <WH2022> yet he will come <WH935> to his end, <WH7093> and no <WH369> one <WH369> will help <WH5826> him.
